definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed â€“ if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don t wake up after lid close
threads.message:
got this unit with high fan spin. found bad battery. after replacement fan is ok.

when i click on the sleep mode, the device goes into sleep mode and wakes up again normally. but when i close the lid it also goes into sleep mode, but after opening it, the display remains dark.

i have already installed a new speaker, assuming the hall sensor is the problem, but the result is the same. then i changed the audioboard, but no change. the original audioboard has a white headphone jack, but my replacement board has a black jack. are there any differences? in diode mode, the readings on the speaker connector are the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don t wake up after lid close
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT signals, when the problem appears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don t wake up after lid close
threads.message:
tryed in another case and all is ok.
Found there is another sensor left side nearby the microphone. after replacing the microphone all is working.


Problem solved
